verbs.description: special report - ocean shock oct 30- this series [V: has] explored the damaging effects of warming waters in the world oceans on marine life and human life stressed by this climate change hidden beneath the waves fish and other marine species are facing enormous disruption we talked to five people intimately involved with the sea google long island sound mexico 12 sea rangers mediterranean pacific island professor national geographic society enric sala bun lai navy bergen canada new haven caribbean new york university christopher haatuft van der werf eric schmidt yale university reuters jennifer jacquet texas environmental scientist lysverket glitne farm u s assistant professor connecticut matthew green maurice tamman kiribati sea ranger service department of environmental studies north sea new england pristine seas kari howard scripps institution of oceanography marine ecologist north africa
